description.narrative: UNPRPD Joint Programme will consolidate multi-stakeholder commitment to the achievement of CRPD-compliant SDGs through a robust legislative/policy framework, sound coordination structures and meaningful participation of OPDs.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1.1 # of participants (disaggregated by type of stakeholder ) disaggregated by sex, disability, rural/urban participating in capacity building activities funded or provided by UNPRPD programmes. 1.1.2 # of participants (disaggregated by type of stakeholder ) disaggregated by sex, disability, rural/urban participating in capacity building activities funded or provided by UNPRPD programmes. 1.1.4 # of OPDs (disaggregated by type umbrella- disability specific- women- underrepresented other) that benefitted from capacity building activities (type of activities ) funded by UNPRPD programmes to strengthen the capacity of organizations of persons with disabilities. 1.1.5 # of capacity building activities funded by UNPRPD programmes, directed at women and girls with disabilities on their rights and requirements and/or directed at underrepresented groups of persons with disabilities on their rights and requirements. 2.1.1. # of national regulatory frameworks and systems changes targeted by the UNPRPD program disaggregated by 1) legislation/regulation, 2) policies/plans/strategies, 3) capacity building programs, 4) operational guidance/standards, 5) direct services/service overhaul/service modelling, 6) audits/reviews/assessments, 7) governmental programs, 8) administrative procedures, 9) formal monitoring and accountability mechanisms or bodies, 10) regulatory/oversite/monitoring systems, 11) financing and budgeting. 3.2.3. # of SDGs implementation data collection, monitoring and accountability processes assessing progress against specific disability-inclusion targets. 3.2.4 # SDGs budgets/financial planning with explicit allocations to disability inclusion. 3.3.2 # of governmental coordination mechanisms with established consultation processes undertaken to ensure the active involvement of persons with disabilities, including through their representative organizations, in the planning, implementation and monitoring of SDGs.

comment.narrative: 1.1.1. A number of meetings and other advocacy measures on the ratification of the CRPD (June 2021); a meeting of the High Commissioner for Human Rights with the Chairperson of the Senate of the Parliament of Uzbekistan (Nov 2020); Legal analysis of selected raft laws and policies related to the rights of persons with disabilities (2020-2021); recommendations by the Special Rapporteur on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (Nov 2019); national consultations on the National Plan of Action for the implementation of the CRPD (October 2021). 1.1.2. 30 participants took part in 1 training-workshop funded by UNPRPD program, May 3-7, 2021 1.1.4 A number of meetings and other advocacy measures on the ratification of the CRPD (June 2021); a meeting of the High Commissioner for Human Rights with the Chairperson of the Senate of the Parliament of Uzbekistan (Nov 2020); Legal analysis of selected raft laws and policies related to the rights of persons with disabilities (2020-2021); recommendations by the Special Rapporteur on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (Nov 2019); national consultations on the National Plan of Action for the implementation of the CRPD (October 2021) 1.1.5. A number of meetings and other advocacy measures on the ratification of the CRPD (June 2021); a meeting of the High Commissioner for Human Rights with the Chairperson of the Senate of the Parliament of Uzbekistan (Nov 2020); Legal analysis of selected raft laws and policies related to the rights of persons with disabilities (2020-2021); recommendations by the Special Rapporteur on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (Nov 2019); national consultations on the National Plan of Action for the implementation of the CRPD (October 2021). 2.1.1. 0 (National regulatory frameworks and systems changes targeted by the UNPRPD program disaggregated by 2) policies/plans/strategies, 3) capacity building programs). 3.2.3 0 (No SDGs implementation data collection, monitoring and accountability processes)

1.1.1. At least 60 participants take part in 3 trainings with the engagement of at least 15 OPDs on organizational capacity building through the UNPRPD programmes. 1.1.2. At least 90 participants take part in 3 capacity building events for at least 15 OPDs, and at least 5 government agencies and sectoral ministries. 1.1.4. At least 2 capacity building events are conducted for at least 15 OPDs and State Statistics Committee on the capacity building of OPDs. 1.1.5. At least 3 capacity building events are conducted for at least 15 OPDs and State Statistics Committee on the rights of underrepresented groups of persons with disabilities. 2.1.1. 1 national regulatory frameworks and systems changes targeted by the UNPRPD program disaggregated by 2) policies/plans/strategies, 3) capacity building programs. 3.2.3. At least 1 capacity building event for Ministry of Justice, the Parliament and the NHRC on the principles of human rights and CRPD. 3.2.4 . 5 SDGs budgets/financial planning with explicit allocations to disability inclusion. 3.3.2. 3 governmental coordination mechanisms with OPD consultation processes undertaken to ensure active engagement of OPDs and PWDs in the planning, implementation and monitoring of SDGs.
